wikipedia_page.main: Reginald John Burrell (26 August 1870 – 16 March 1948) was an English cricketer active from 1894 to 1904 who played for Essex. He was born in Kirtling and died in Suffolk. He appeared in ten first-class matches and scored 200 runs with a highest score of 40.

response: * John Burrell (poet), Scottish poet and goldsmith
* John Burrell (American football) (born 1940), former American football wide receiver
* John Burrell (theatre director) (1910–1972), English theatre director
The son of John Burrell of Kirtling, Cambridgeshire, Burrell was educated at Charterhouse School and matriculated at Magdalen College, Oxford in 1885. He graduated B.A. in 1889 and M.A. in 1892.
